column3:
Not sure I see the value, because software really should be able to track that without txindex.

But it looks correct, no objections...
This has nothing to do with `-txindex`. It just refers to the output index inside the transaction.\n
To be compatible with `lockunspent`, I'd use `vout` as field name.\n
My comment was not referring to -txindex.\n
So this is the `vout` index? Sounds useful to me.\n`txindex` got me confused as well.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/08f149783684e05f7252062381bfa429e3861b77 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

Glancing at the code, I'm pretty sure CoinJoin-like transactions (where you do not own all of the outputs of a transaction) will result in vout numbers that do not match the transaction, because CWalletTx::GetAmounts skips outputs that don't affect the wallet.\n\nSo... NACK from me. Edge cases like CoinJoin-like transactions is why I'm going to start insisting that  changes to the wallet or accoun
Agreed, vout index should count all vouts, not just the ones that affect the current wallet, so that it can be used to globally identify the txid-vout pair.\n
OK. I'll try add the correct vout.\n
